metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Clusters are collections of data based on similarity.
content.html: Clusters are collections of data based on similarity.

content.text: Data points clustered together in a graph can often be classified into clusters.
content.html: Data points clustered together in a graph can often be classified into clusters.

content.text: In the graph below we can distinguish 3 different clusters:
content.html: In the graph below we can distinguish 3 different clusters:

content.text: Clusters can hold a lot of valuable information, but clusters come in all sorts of shapes, so how can we recognize them?
content.html: Clusters can hold a lot of valuable information, but clusters come in all sorts of shapes, so how can we recognize them?

content.text: Clustering is a type of Unsupervised Learning .

The Density Method considers points in a dense regions to have more similarities and differences than points in a lower dense region. The density method has a good accuracy. It also has the ability to merge clusters. Two common algorithms are DBSCAN and OPTICS.
content.html:
The Density Method considers points in a dense regions to have more similarities and differences than points in a lower dense region. The density method has a good accuracy. It also has the ability to merge clusters.
Two common algorithms are DBSCAN and OPTICS.

content.text: The Hierarchical Method forms the clusters in a tree-type structure. New clusters are formed using previously formed clusters. Two common algorithms are CURE and BIRCH.
content.html:
The Hierarchical Method forms the clusters in a tree-type structure. New clusters are formed using previously formed clusters.
Two common algorithms are CURE and BIRCH.

content.text: The Grid-based Method formulates the data into a finite number of cells that form a grid-like structure. Two common algorithms are CLIQUE and STING
content.html:
The Grid-based Method formulates the data into a finite number of cells that form a grid-like structure.
Two common algorithms are CLIQUE and STING

content.text: The Partitioning Method partitions the objects into k clusters and each partition forms one cluster. One common algorithm is CLARANS.
content.html:
The Partitioning Method partitions the objects into k clusters and each partition forms one cluster.
One common algorithm is CLARANS.

content.text: The Correlation Coefficient (r) describes the strength and direction of a linear relationship and x/y variables on a scatterplot.
content.html: The Correlation Coefficient (r) describes the strength and direction of a linear relationship and x/y variables on a scatterplot.

content.text: The value of r is always between -1 and +1:
content.html: The value of r is always between -1 and +1:
